we like it: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EWhile the Z Fold 6 might be Samsung's most advanced phone, the latest S25 Edge is arguably the runner-up, flaunting an ultra-thin form factor that gives it the benefit of having a large 6.7-inch AMOLED display\u003Cem\u003E and\u003C\u002Fem\u003E a lightweight hand feel. I've been testing the phone for a little more than a week, and it still blows my mind how this design combination exists in 2025. Picking up almost any other big-screen phone is like taking a step back in time.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWhile the S25 Edge is the first of its kind, it features the best aspects of the standard Galaxy S25 models, including the tried-and-tested 200MP main camera of the Ultra, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset with 12GB of RAM, and a display that gets brighter than most phones when outdoors. Based on my review, the lack of a dedicated telephoto lens on the S25 Edge wasn't sorely missed, as the main sensor retained a good amount of detail even after digitally cropping.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EReview:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.zdnet.com\u002Farticle\u002Fi-replaced-my-samsung-s25-ultra-with-the-edge-model-for-three-weeks-heres-my-verdict-now\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESamsung Galaxy S25 Edge\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho it's\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Cstrong\u003Efor\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E: Tech enthusiasts and users with delicate wrists (myself included) will benefit from the ultra-thin design of the S25 Edge. It really is one of those phones you have to see and hold to truly grasp its extraordinance. And once you use it, every other device will feel like a brick in your hand.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EYou'll also have to be willing to splurge a bit, as the S25 Edge starts at $1,099 for the 256GB variant. That puts it right in between the S25 Plus ($999) and S25 Ultra ($1,299), both of which field larger batteries and more cameras. Should you find a competitive trade-in offer at a retailer or carrier store, then the S25 Edge and its unique design may be worth considering.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho should look elsewhere: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EWhile the price of the S25 Edge is one barrier to entry, I'd put it after the most significant caveat, which is battery life. With only a 3,900mAh capacity -- smaller than the standard Galaxy S25's 4,000mAh) -- you should expect to charge the S25 Edge by late afternoon. As a power user, I often found myself topping up the phone before the end of my work shifts, which is not the most ideal if you're a frequent traveler or don't often have a charger nearby.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003ETherefore, if endurance is a priority for you, I'd recommend the S25 Plus (4,900mAh) or Ultra (5,000mAh) models instead. If you're not a fan of Samsung's OneUI software, often criticized for having\u003Cem\u003E too\u003C\u002Fem\u003E many features and apps, it may also be worthwhile to wait for Apple's rumored iPhone we like it: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThe Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 represents the culmination of years of refinement since the first Galaxy Fold in 2019, incorporating iterative improvements seen in previous models. This latest iteration delivers the most polished design we've tested, featuring flatter edges for a modern feel, a wider internal display for better usability, and a noticeably lighter construction than its predecessor. \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EDurability sees significant upgrades, with a new Dual Rail Hinge engineered to better distribute shock, an edge designed to withstand pressure and sharp objects, enhanced armor aluminum for scratch resistance, and, crucially, an IP48 rating, adding dust resistance for the first time alongside water resistance. The hand feel of the Z Fold 6 is noticeably more sturdy than competitors like the Pixel 9 Pro Fold and OnePlus Open.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EBeyond the physical enhancements, a major draw is the integration of advanced Galaxy AI features like Circle to Search, Note Assist, and Interpreter Mode translations, powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chip and 12GB of RAM. In ways, the larger inner display is the perfect canvas for chatbot experiences, sketching, and more. While the camera hardware remains similar to the Z Fold 5's, I've found the enhanced image processing beneficial for capturing low-light photography and preserving (or improving) distant details.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EReview:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.zdnet.com\u002Farticle\u002Fi-replaced-my-samsung-galaxy-s24-ultra-with-the-z-fold-6-for-a-week-and-cant-go-back\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESamsung Galaxy Z Fold 6\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho it's for: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThe Galaxy Z Fold 6 is primarily aimed at users seeking the most advanced and refined large-screen foldable experience currently offered by Samsung. Thanks to its specific enhancements, such as the new hinge design, tougher materials, and the valuable addition of dust resistance with its IP48 rating, it should appeal to those who prioritize durability in a foldable phone.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EFurthermore, individuals keen on leveraging cutting-edge AI tools, particularly those optimized for a larger, tablet-like screen, will find the Z Fold 6 compelling. It fits nicely for tech enthusiasts and early adopters willing to invest in the latest foldable technology. For some, the attractive trade-in offers by Samsung and US carriers can help make the considerable investment more feasible.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho should look elsewhere: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThe Galaxy Z Fold 6's high starting price of $1,900 makes it one of the most expensive phones on the market, placing it out of reach for many budget-conscious buyers. Additionally, those expecting a significant leap in camera hardware over the Z Fold 5 might be slightly disappointed, as the main improvements lie in AI-driven software processing rather than substantially new sensors or lenses.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIf the price is a primary barrier or if exploring different approaches to the large-screen foldable concept is desired, I've tested and recommend some alternatives. Competitors like the OnePlus Open or the Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold are worth considering, as they may offer compelling features and potentially a more accessible price point for a large foldable device.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESamsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 tech specs: Processor:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 | \u003Cstrong\u003EMain display:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E 7.6 inches | \u003Cstrong\u003ECover display:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E 6.3 inches | \u003Cstrong\u003ERAM\u002FStorage:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E 12GB of RAM with It's for those seeking reliable essentials, including students, children, elders, and casual users.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIt also suits those who want a better-than-average 90Hz AMOLED display -- most phones in this price range have 60Hz displays for more stuttery animations -- and a decent camera for everyday use, backed by long-term software support.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho should look elsewhere: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EI always remind readers that expectations should align with the price; the A16 5G lacks the premium feel and top-tier performance of flagships, and that's to be expected. we like it: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EFor those prioritizing excellent value -- getting the most \"bang for your buck\" -- the Galaxy A35 5G presents a compelling case, potentially steering buyers away from the pricier S and Z series. There are three standout reasons why this device arguably surpasses other sub-$400 options: it boasts a fantastic 6.6-inch AMOLED display that smoothly ramps up to a 120Hz refresh rate, features a versatile triple-camera system headlined by a 50MP main sensor, and includes a 5,000mAh battery that lasted me well into the night.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWith the A35 5G, Samsung focused on the features users value most at this price point. Compared to its predecessor, the A34 5G, this model offers tangible upgrades like a more premium glass backing, a higher-performing Exynos chipset, and enhancements to the camera system. Crucially, its inclusion in Samsung's five-year software and security update commitment offers longevity rarely matched by competitors in this price bracket.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EReview: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.zdnet.com\u002Farticle\u002Fforget-pixel-8a-this-399-samsung-phone-is-a-force-to-be-reckoned-with\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESamsung Galaxy A35 5G\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho it's for: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThe Galaxy A35 5G is primarily targeted towards value-conscious consumers seeking a highly capable smartphone under the $400 mark. Its combination of a high-quality 120Hz AMOLED screen, a respectable 50MP main camera, and a large 5,000mAh battery addresses the core features many users look for in a reliable daily driver. I recommend the Samsung phone to most people who want a little more power and performance than traditional budget handsets.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThe A35 5G is also an excellent choice for individuals who value long-term usability and security. The five-year update commitment provides peace of mind and considerably extends the device's lifespan compared to rivals like Motorola and OnePlus.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho should look elsewhere: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EWhile the A35 5G excels in value, it may not satisfy users seeking specific niche features or aesthetics found in some competitors. Those prioritizing a particularly unique or \"exciting\" design language might find alternatives like the Nothing Phone 3a more visually appealing.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EFurthermore, if rapid charging speed is a necessity, other devices could be a better fit; the OnePlus 13R, for example, supports up to 80W wired charging (compared to Samsung's 25W). Another alternative, the Google Pixel 9a, offers a more user-friendly software experience, with less bloatware (read: pre-installed applications and services) than the Samsung.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESamsung Galaxy A35 5G Samsung\u003C\u002Fa\u003E regarding the overall phone experience, Samsung is arguably the best option in 2025. Having tested the latest handsets from both brands (and others), I find that the Samsung Galaxy continues to offer the most features and capabilities at relatively competitive prices.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWhen compared to the Google Pixel lineup specifically, Samsung wins out by having a more robust software experience, with greater customizability for users to modify settings, home screen setups, app behaviors, and more. It's pricier than most, but is worth the money if you want a no-frills handset that can do just about everything.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\u003Ctr\u003E\u003Ctd\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESamsung Galaxy S25 Plus\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\u003Ctd\u003E\u003Cp\u003EA Galaxy phone capable of accomplishing 90% of what the Ultra model can do and costs less. It's arguably the best foldable phone on the market, too.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\u003Ctr\u003E\u003Ctd\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESamsung Galaxy S25 Edge\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\u003Ctd\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAn ultra-thin and lightweight phone that doesn't compromise on performance. How a phone is designed, what materials the manufacturer chooses, and whether the device can take a hit or two are considered when picking the very best.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECameras\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E: The camera systems on Samsung phones have gotten superb over the past few years, so much so that you're well off even if you opt for a mid-ranger like the \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.zdnet.com\u002Farticle\u002Fthis-399-samsung-galaxy-is-the-mid-range-phone-most-people-should-buy\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EGalaxy A56\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESpecial features\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E: If there's one thing that differentiates most Samsung phones from other manufacturers, it's unique features. From the S24 Ultra with its built-in stylus and 200MP camera to the foldable screens of the Z Fold and Z Flip, you'll feel a sense of wonderment when using something that's built differently. \u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAvailability\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E: Samsung has a reputation for bringing the wildest phones to the press, even if they're not readily available. Here's a breakdown of every factor we consider before we make recommendations:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDesign and ergonomics:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E How good a phone looks and feels plays a big role in many users' buying journeys, so we consider these aspects heavily when testing.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPerformance: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003ESeveral factors affect a phone's performance, including LTE\u002F5G signal, battery life, and background tasks. Therefore, we typically begin our evaluations with a fully charged handset, all background tasks closed, and the most stable mobile connection possible.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECamera quality:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E ZDNET tests phone cameras by capturing hundreds of photos and videos of various subjects and in various lighting conditions. We also compare the output to that of older models.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBattery life and charging:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E It's also important for us to evaluate how long phones last under light, moderate, and heavy usage, how long they take to recharge, and how they do it (wired, wireless, or both).\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ESpecial features:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E These features distinguish tested devices from a bustling smartphone market and hopefully bring added value to users, not the opposite.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPricing and availability: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EBeyond budget considerations, we also note if a phone is available in the US or only internationally.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\u003Cp\u003EFor a more extensive breakdown, check out our comprehensive \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.zdnet.com\u002Farticle\u002Fhow-we-test-phones\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ephone testing methodology page\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E",edition:a,dislike:a,hed:"How we test Samsung phones",imageCaptionOverride:a,imageCreditOverride:a,imageGroup:{},like:a,merchantOffers:[],shortcodeType:"listicle",subhed:a,supplementalText:a,supplementalUrl:a,techProd:c,usePricing:b},{uuid:"92a5cba0-63ed-4a5c-9bd9-9d962a908346",creditCardData:c,description:"\u003Cp\u003EThe latest version of Android, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.zdnet.com\u002Farticle\u002Fandroid-15-unveiled-here-are-8-new-exciting-features-coming-to-your-phone\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EAndroid 15\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, is expected to arrive on supported Samsung Galaxy phones starting in early 2025.
